intro: Stenogyne meeboldii, commonly known as the Kauai honeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming during the summer months. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories on the island of Kauai. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
